intro: Callista spatella, commonly known as the narrowleaf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Callista spatella is often found in rich, well-drained soils and can thrive in partial to full shade.
